alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:28PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern DeKalb County through 300 PM CDT... At 228 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fyffe to near Tabor Road. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Payne, Rainsville, Fyffe, Pine Ridge, Lakeview, Dog Town, Guest, Collbran, Little River Canyon NP and Lebanon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for northeastern Alabama.
